channel.title: India Latest News: Top National Headlines Today & Breaking News | The Hindu
channel.description: National news and headlines from within or around India with live updates on major breaking events from The Hindu.

image.title: India Latest News: Top National Headlines Today & Breaking News | The Hindu

item.title: Seven feared dead, several missing in massive Kolkata warehouse fire
item.description: More than 20 people feared trapped inside the warehouse gutted in the fire; no official confirmation of casualties issued by the administration till late Monday, January 26, evening

item.title: Families displaced during Kogilu Layout demolition observe ‘Poor People’s Republic Day’
Public urged to work together for development of NTR district
item.description: A plan is being implemented to achieve an annual growth rate of 18.5% across all sectors in the district, says Lakshmisha during the Republic Day celebrations at IGMC Stadium

item.title: Governor honours individuals, organisations with Excellence awards 2025
AIDWA slams Centre for its ‘anti-people polices’
Indians abroad celebrate Republic Day; greetings pour in from world leaders
item.description: Extending his wishes, U.S. President Trump says 'U.S.-India share historic bond'; Chinese President Xi says India-China relations continue to improve and develop, aligning with the fundamental interests of both countries and their people

item.title: Vande Mataram tableaux at the Republic Day parade
item.description: The notes of the national song rang clear as the Culture Ministry’s tableau, themed around ‘Vande Mataram: Swatantrata ka Mantra (freedom chant)’, rolled out on Kartavya Path

item.title: Constitution is protective shield for citizen rights, says Rahul Gandhi on 77th Republic Day
item.description: Congress leaders criticise the government for not offering front row seats to the Leaders of Opposition in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha during the Republic Day parade

item.title: Long march to Mumbai: Protesters march towards Mumbai, refuse to stop without meeting CM
item.description: Delegation to meet Ministers and officials in Mumbai on January 27; at the heart of the protest is the high rate of rejections of land ownership claims under the Forest Rights Act, and other issues pertaining to its implementation

item.title: BJP-JD(S) too set to protest today
Sidlaghatta civic official threat case: Rajeev Gowda arrested at Kerala border
Suresh Kumar questions propriety of Congress protest
Republic Day 2026: How was the Constitution amended in PM Modi’s second term
item.description: Constitutional amendments granting higher representation to SC,ST, OBC and women passed Parliament since 2019

item.title: GBA chief orders immediate work on Ejipura Flyover, mark St. John’s land
Republic Day 2026: How was the Constitution amended in PM Modi’s first term
item.description: Judicial, tax, foreign reforms took centre stage in Modi’s first term, before reservation caught up by in 2019

item.title: BMRCL begins beautification drive under Pink Line on Bannerghatta Road
item.description: BMRCL has confirmed that the much-anticipated Pink Line corridor will be opened in phases by September 2026. The 7.5-km elevated section from Tavarekere to Kalena Agrahara, running along Bannerghatta Road, is expected to be commissioned by March 2026

item.title: Kadapa stands first among ‘Aspiration districts’ pan India, says Collector
Former bonded labourer unfurls tricolour as Sarpanch in Amaragiri
CM Revanth begins leadership programme at Harvard University
Wikipedia is not going anywhere, says founder Jimmy Wales as online encyclopaedia completes 25 years
item.description: The Internet entrepreneur speaks on credibility, community, and the future of shared information

item.title: Furniture store fire tragedy in Nampally mirrors last year’s disaster near Gulzar Houz
SC Commission member urges immediate FIRs for Dalit atrocities reports
Canadian PM Mark Carney likely to visit India in early March, India’s envoy to Canada says
item.description: Formal negotiations for a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement with India should also start in March, India’s ​High Commissioner to Canada Dinesh Patnaik says

item.title: DISCOM ratings improved under coalition government: Energy Minister
Tuthika Srinivasa Vishwanath recognised as Best District Officer in Polavaram District
NLCIL celebrates Republic Day
Ideas, identity and intimate histories bring Hyderabad Literary Festival 2026 to a close
GPS tracker helps woman recover stolen bag within hours
All set for annual celestial wedding at Antarvedi temple in Konaseema
item.description: The devotees will take part in the procession of the chariot on January 29 and take holy dip the next day in the confluence point of Godavari into sea at Antarvedi

item.title: TDP, JSP celebrate 77th Republic Day at party offices near Mangalagiri
India-EU FTA negotiations done, to be announced on January 27: Commerce Secretary
item.description: Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal said that while the closure of negotiations will be announced, the actual deal will be signed once the language goes through legal scrubbing

item.title: SIT issues notice to former MP Santosh Kumar in phone tapping case
New Zealand Maori delegation performs haka at Medaram shrine
TTD plans nationwide outreach to spread glory of Lord Venkateswara
item.description: EO outlines temple expansion, pilgrim facilities and green initiatives at Republic Day event

item.title: Parents among five arrested for selling newborn girl in Chamarajanagar for ₹ 50,000
Congress seeks apology from KTR for ‘insulting’ Speaker and Constitution
Vizianagaram Sub-Inspector selected for President’s 'Medal for Meritorious Service’
Governor hosts ‘At Home’ reception on Republic Day in Vijayawada
Congress, BRS hindering development, alleges Telangana BJP chief
Tirupati aims to boost GSDP by 18% by 2028, says Collector S. Venkateswar
R-Day celebrations: Vizianagaram SHGs get massive funds
Innovation, bold leadership key to nation’s progress: N.V.S. Reddy
Tenant Farmers Association seeks panel to probe farmer suicides in A.P.
Naidu pushes technology-driven governance, names 2026 decision-making year
item.description: Chief Minister stresses use of AI and digital tools to reduce field staff workload, speed up grievance redressal and improve service delivery across departments

item.title: Justice is not an abstract ideal but a daily pursuit: HC CJ A.K. Singh
Hyderabad student emerges national winner
Godavari Delta to be surveyed at cost of over ₹13 crore
item.description: Eight pacts signed to attract ₹58,850 crore investments in Kakinada district during CII-Visakhapatnam summit-2025; A fleet of 50 EV buses to be deployed in East Godavari by 2026 end

item.title: Seven held as cybercrime police detect six fraud cases in a week
Petbasheerabad police rescue man attempting suicide on railway tracks near Ayodhya Nagar
Nori Dattatreyudu expresses delight after Padma Bhushan honour
item.description: This recognition from my own country, my people, and my government holds special significance, says the noted radiation oncologist

item.title: IRISET eyes ISRO tie‑up for ‘Kavach’ upgrade
Man killed after being dragged by car in Bengaluru’s Hebbagodi, friend arrested
Man arrested for illegal sale of steroid injections in Hyderabad
ACB raid uncovers major lapses at Kamareddy civil supplies office
Mysuru railway division, University of Mysore, Music University celebrate 77th Republic Day
Republic Day celebrated with grandeur in Sathya Sai and Annamayya districts
Eluru Collector calls for dedicated efforts for district’s development on R-Day
item.description: She highlights the government’s achievements, including financial assistance to over 1.6 lakh farmers, distribution of mechanised farming equipment, procurement of Kharif crops, among others

item.title: Congress tries out year-round grassroots mobilisation model in Jharkhand
item.description: AICC in-charge K. Raju has drawn up a year-long calendar of activities involving party workers and leaders across nearly 4,350 gram panchayats in the State

item.title: TTD reaffirms commitment to top-tier pilgrim services
Take a pause from Budget politics and rethink governance: Nobel Laureate Abhijit Banerjee
Visva Bharati to sign MoU with SRFTI
item.description: The MoU will be signed on January 28 for exchange of study and research between the two institutes

item.title: 77th Republic Day celebrated with patriotic fervour in Nandyal, Kurnool, Anantapur districts
Republic Day celebrated with mock fire drill at gated community in Old Alwal to enhance safety awareness
item.description: Residents were made aware of the steps to be taken to handle fire accidents and emergency situations

item.title: AP Transco aims to complete 55 transmission projects this year: Joint MD
item.description: Projects worth ₹9,320 crore to add 8,853 MVA capacity and 1,558 circuit km lines to strengthen State power grid, he says

item.title: Kashmiri will survive in grief, sorrow and lament: Padma Shri nominee Shauq
item.description: Shafi Shauq described the Padma Shri award, among the highest civilian honours in India, as “an acknowledgement of the richness of Kashmiri language”

item.title: Mayawati reiterates demand of Bharat Ratna for BSP founder Kanshi Ram
item.description: On Republic Day, Bahujan Samaj Party leader calls for an ‘honest assessment’ of whether Central and State governments have made ‘much-needed improvement in the standard of living of the people’

item.title: Vizianagaram to host U-14 South Zone cricket tourney from January 27
Eluru Collector honours Information department staff for exemplary services
item.description: According to district administration, their consistent dedication and professional excellence earned them accolades

item.title: Women craft R-Day greetings with 20,000 plants in Kadiyam
item.description: At least 20 workers, mostly women, toiled to create a greeting with plants for four days

item.title: Complaint filed against fake social media accounts misusing KSIC name
Andhra Pradesh Speaker proposes Right to Recall, no work no pay for MLAs
item.description: Speaking at the 77th Republic Day celebrations at the State Assembly, Ayyanna Patrudu calls for a minimum of 60 sitting days a year to restore the dignity of legislatures, while Legislative Council Chairman Koyye Moshenu Raju hails the Constitution as the greatest guiding text

item.title: SCR posts record performance across sectors
BMTC bus reverses into railway track , gets hit by passing train
Land acquisition for Hyderabad Metro phase‑2 underway, says HMR MD
IG, SP participate in R-Day celebrations at Eluru
State likely to set up committee for Gig Workers’ Welfare Board today
item.description: The board will have 15 members, with representation from the government, gig workers, aggregator bodies and civil society

item.title: Boseraju lays foundation stone for new police residential quarters in Madikeri
Chittoor Collector calls for inclusive, sustainable development at 77th Republic Day celebrations
Suspected militants torch houses, farmhouses in Manipur’s Kangpokpi district
item.description: The Zeliangrong United Front (ZUF) has claimed responsibility for the act and alleged that the houses and farmhouses were being used by illicit poppy cultivators

item.title: APSLSA Executive Chairman unfurls national flag on Republic Day
A.P. Food Safety department tightens focus on sale of cotton candy
item.description: Despite containing harmful colouring agent Rhodamine B, the use of which is prohibited in the State, the sale of cotton candy continues in public gatherings in Vijayawada, including the recent Vijayawada Book Festival

item.title: Attempts being made to weaken Constitution: Siddaramaiah
A.P. government approves ₹3.07 crore bridge over Chama Canal in Nandyal
BJP celebrates Republic Day with call for unity and nation-first mindset
item.description: The party State unit president pays tributes to Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and Dr. B. R. Ambedkar

item.title: Two-day national seminar on pepper by KSNUAHS
Country enjoying freedom due to Congress’s sacrifices: TPCC president Mahesh Kumar Goud
RBI flags risks of expanding DBTs as Telangana’s subsidy bill rises
item.description: RBI study expresses concern over rise in share of social security and welfare

item.title: Lok Bhavan Chalo by Congress today demanding roll back of VB-G RAM-G Act
Centre must encourage States that record progress: Krishna Byre Gowda
SCR Vijayawada officials celebrate Republic Day
KTR alleges violation of Constitution in Telangana under Congress
Constitution guiding force for democracy, judiciary, says Andhra Pradesh High Court Chief Justice
item.description: Justice Thakur highlights judiciary’s role in social change, urges citizens to preserve India’s social fabric on 77th Republic Day

item.title: Governor could have skipped MGNREGA part if he was not interested in it: Shivakumar
Punjab farmers take out tractor marches demanding withdrawal of Electricity (Amendment) Bill
item.description: The demonstrations were organised to demand the withdrawal of the Electricity (Amendment) Bill 2025, the Seeds Bill 2025, repeal of labour codes, restoration of the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act and legal guarantee for minimum support price on crops

item.title: Three killed, four injured as car crashes into truck on Tumakuru highway
item.description: Preliminary investigation suggests that the car was overspeeding and rammed the truck from behind. The impact was severe, leaving the car completely mangled and trapping the occupants inside the vehicle

item.title: Two from Mysuru dead as boat capsizes near Malpe
item.description: Though all 14 tourists aboard the boat were given life jackets, only a few were wearing them at the time of the incident.

item.title: A.P. govt. restored stability, rebuilt confidence after a lack of direction for years: Governor
item.description: Speaking in the Republic Day celebrations in Amaravati, Governor Abdul Nazeer says Amaravati was being developed with renewed vigour, having secured financial closures for key projects including the N5 and E3 roads and the Governor’s Residence Complex

item.title: Watch: 77th Republic Day parade highlights
item.description: India ushered in its 77th Republic Day on Monday (January 26, 2026) with a grand display of its military prowess that included missiles, warplanes, newly-raised units and lethal weapon systems used during Operation Sindoor.

item.title: Patta transfer in Tamil Nadu: Officials asked to digitally process applications
item.description: The Director of Survey and Settlement has instructed Collectors and Assistant Directors of Survey and Land Records not to process manual note files and not to manually approve sub-division statements by Tahsildars.

item.title: Uttarakhand’s Char Dham temples want ban on entry of non-Hindus
item.description: The four shrines are the backbone of the State’s economy and are visited by millions of people from across India every year
